did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: ILR School Ives Hallway Portrait Gallery Photographs

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: New York State School of Industrial and Labor Relations (NYSSILR)

did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: This collection consists of portraits of many labor leaders and labor activists. These portraits hung on the hallway walls of Ives Hall, at the ILR School. For a complete listing see the folder listing for this collection.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of portraits of many labor leaders and labor activists. These portraits hung on the hallway walls of Ives Hall, at the ILR School. For a complete listing see the folder listing for this collection.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: New York State School of Industrial and Labor Relations

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: ILR School Ives Hallway Portrait Gallery Photographs #/4280 P. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.p:

did.unittitle: Marcus Alonzo Hanna (1837-1904) Capitalist, Politician: Agnes Nestor (1880-1948) Labor Leader, Suffragette
Matthew Woll (1880-1956) Pres. Int'l. Photo Engravers Union of N.A.: Iorwith Wilber Abel (1908-) Pres. United Steelworkers of America
Andrew Furuseth (1854-1938) Pres. Int'l. Seamen's Union: William Dudley Haywood (1869-1928) Organizer
Louis Dembitz Brandeis (1856-1941) Supreme Court Justice: Elbert Henry Gary (1864-1927) Corporation Lawyer Financier
Mary Harris Jones (1830-1930) Labor Leader: John Llewellyn Lewis (1880-1969) Pres. United Mine Workers of America
John Philip Frey (1871-1957) Vice Pres. Int'l. Molders and Foundry Workers of America: Walter Philip Reuther (1907-1970) Pres. United Automobile, Aircraft, Agricultural Implement Workers of America
Eugene Victor Debs (1855-1926) Socialist Labor Organizer: William Sidell (1915-) General Pres. Bro. of Carpenters and Joiners of America
David Dubinsky (1892-1982) Pres. ILGWU: Peter Joseph Brennan (1918-) Pres. Construction Trades Council of Greater NY
Ethan Henry Gary (1846-1927) Corporation Lawyer Financier: Owen D. Young (1874-1962) Corporate Officer
Samuel Gompers (1850-1924) Pres. AFL: David Lewis Behnke (1897-1953) Pres. Air Line Pilots Assoc.
William Green (1872-1952) Pres. AFL: William Hugh Johnston (1874-1937) Pres. Int'l. Assoc. of Machinists
Paul Joseph Jennings (1918-) Pres. Int'l. Union of Electrical, Radio and Machine Workers: Oliver Wendal Holmes (1841-1935) Supreme Court Justice
George Mortimer Pullman (1831-1897) Industrialist: Seth Low (1850-1916) Political Reformer
Alfred Pritchard Sloan, Jr. (1875-1966) Industrialist: Norman Thomas (1884-1969) Socialist Leader
Jay Gould (1836-1892) Financier: Ralph Montgomery Easley (1856-1939) Reformer
Terence Vincent Powderly (1849-1924) Grandmaster Workman Knights of Labor: Horace Greely (1811-1872) Editor, Political Leader
Charles Luna (1906-) First Pres. UTU: Elizabeth Gurley Flynn (1890-1964) Socialist, Labor Organizer
Joseph Daniel Keenan (1896-) Int'l. Secretary IBEW: Hugo Lafayette Black (1886-) Supreme Court Justice
Michael Joseph Quill (1905-1966) Pres. Transport Workers Union of America: Lincoln Steffens (1866-1936) Journalist, Reformer
Al H. Chesser (1914-) Pres. UTU: Harriet Tubman (1821-1913) Abolitionist, Author
Harold J. Gibbons (1910-) Vice Pres. Int'l. Bro. of Teamsters, Chauffeurs, Warehousemen, and Helpers of America: Clarence Seward Darrow (1857-1938) Social Reformer
Henry Ford II (1917-) Automobile Manufacturer: Robert Alphonso Taft (1889-1953) U.S. Senator
Charles Michael Schwab (1862-1939) Industrialist: Hubert Horatio Humphrey (1911-1978) United States Senator Labor and Civil Rights Advocate
Henry Ford I (1863-1947) Automobile Manufacturer: Emma Goldman (1869-1940) Social Reformer
Edsel Ford (1893-1943) Automobile Manufacturer: Harry VanArsdale, Jr. (1905-) Pres. NYC Central Labor Council
Frank Edward Fitzsimmons (1908-) Pres. Int'l. Bro. of Teamsters, Chauffeurs, Warehousemen, and Helpers of America: David John McDonald (1902-) Pres. United Steelworkers of America
Delores Clara Huerta (1930-) First Vice-Pres. United Farm Workers of America
Margaret Drier Robins (1869-1945) Social Economist
A. Philip Randolph (1889-) Pres. Brotherhood of Sleeping Car Porters
